attributes.action: Appoint a youth representative to negotiations on exiting the European Union.
attributes.background: Acknowledging the evidence that 75% of young people (18-25) voted to remain in the EU referendum, we call on the government to include a youth representative in the negotiations on Britain's exit from the EU to speak for young people and their future in Europe.
attributes.additional_details:
The polls up to and following the referendum showed young people overwhelmingly in favour of Europe, one of the largest of these shows that 18-25 year olds clearly voted to remain: http://lordashcroftpolls.com/2016/06/how-the-united-kingdom-voted-and-why/

Recognising that this affects the future of our country and our long term economic stability, we ask that young people get a voice in shaping this future.

attributes.action: Allow European residents living in UK to vote if there's another EU referendum
attributes.background: I am a Spanish resident living in London since 2000, working in the NHS and paying my taxes in this country. I believe is very unfair that the EU citizens did not have the opportunity to vote if we want to be out or in from the EU. My request is to give us a voice as we are tax payers supporting UK

attributes.action: UK time to ban animals in captivity in zoos and circuses 
attributes.background: Keeping animals in captivity and out of their natural habitat does not benefit them or their species in any way. Large animals like elephants and bears suffer the most as in the wild they roam for many miles daily. Species conservation is best done in the wild, without cages.
attributes.additional_details:
I took my son to a zoo and a circus when he was small & I felt always very sorry for the all the creatures there, I had no knowledge or background in species behavior, however I could still tell these animals were not at their natural best. 
Tigers pacing up and down relentlessly, little intelligent monkeys trying to communicate via the glass and elephants with very little space to live in. 
It all felt wrong then & now I know its wrong, its time to stop.

attributes.action: Discuss a possible free trade area with the rest of the Commonwealth of Nations.
attributes.background:
We, the British people, will vote on the 23rd of June whether we leave the EU or remain.
In order to silence fear-mongering, we need a plan.
How about the Commonwealth of Nations, our friends that we turned our backs on 41 years ago in favour of signing up, unknowingly, for an EU straightjacket.
attributes.additional_details:
A free trade area between the 53 states of the Commonwealth of Nations would be within the interests of the British economy.
13 of these countries are among the fastest growing in the world.
“The Commonwealth is the ideal platform for business and trade… I hope that India’s ties with the Commonwealth will move from strength to strength, and that the new paradigm will only mean greater warmth, greater co-operation.” Kamal Nath, Former Indian Development Minister
The Commonwealth is the future.

attributes.action: The UK must not leave the European Economic Area (EEA) without a referendum
attributes.background: The UK voted in a referendum on 23rd June 2016 to leave the European Union. No referendum has been held on whether the UK should leave the European Economic Area (EEA). Therefore we, the undersigned, ask HM Government to legislate that the United Kingdom cannot leave the EEA without a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: The European Economic Area (EEA) comprises all 28 EU member states plus Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein. Membership of the EU and EEA is separate, as evidenced by Croatia's joining of the EU on 1st July 2013 and its delayed provisional joining of the EEA on 12th April 2014. Most rights enjoyed by citizens of EU countries apply equally to citizens of EEA countries, most notably the free movement of people. If the UK leaves the EU without leaving the EEA, it will be similar to Norway or Iceland.

attributes.action: RAF Mildenhall as an alternative Dragracing track
attributes.background: The United States Air Force pulls out of RAF Mildenhall in 2022. Mildenhall airport is fully operational and could easily be reused as a motorsport venue.

attributes.action: Make Southern Rail give automatic refunds to all customers affected by delays.
attributes.background: For months now, those of us who travel on Southern have been blighted by delays due to 'staff sickness' which has since morphed into 'a shortage of train crew'. Annual ticket holders get no compensation and it is not simple for others to claim, so Southern continue to profit on poor performance.
attributes.additional_details:
Southern services continue to be severely affected by train crew availability including a high level of conductor sickness, which is leading to some services being cancelled for part or all of their journey.
Planned industrial action affecting Southern services on Tuesday 21 June
A list of the services which have been pre-cancelled is available here.

http://www.southernrailway.com/your-journey/plan-your-journey/live-running-information/incidents/#iAD816EDFC4114A84A299ABF7D41FE43F

attributes.action: To stop/prevent a second referendum on Scottish independence.
attributes.background: As a result of the outcome of the EU referendum it has created a cocktail of uncertainty. Political stability will decrease the economic consequences. If a second referendum on Scottish independence is on the table, it will create more uncertainty and result in complete economic turmoil.

attributes.action: Cancel the court closures announced on 11th February, 2016 and improve justice.
attributes.background: There are currently 460 courts and tribunals in E & W.  The govt. announced the closure of 86 of these, claiming they are substantially under used. Why not ensure that they are used more often - speeding up justice. It claims that they will be within a 1 hour car journey, ignores public transport.
attributes.additional_details: The Govt. claims that the 86 courts are under used by 60%. This could be addressed by ensuring that matters are listed more quickly and the courts used more effectively. The Govt. claims that 97% of citizens will still be able to reach a court, by car, within an hour, ignoring those without cars. There are examples of round trips that will be costly and exceed four hours. This will stop justice being local and accessible.

attributes.action: Drivers caught using a mobile phone whilst driving 6 penalty points. £1000 fine.
attributes.background: I have been an undertaker for many years. I have witnessed the aftermath and carnage whilst attending fatal crashes, where driver has been distracted by using mobile phone and lost control. The percentage of motorists using phones has risen!!! in the past 5 years. They are laughing at the law.
attributes.additional_details: I still remember attending a fatality where the driver had driven into back of lorry...his mobile phone still connected to the call.

attributes.action: Create a Ministerial position for the Self Employed
attributes.background:
There are almost 4.8 million self employed people in the UK who have no direct representation in Government.  Whilst there is a Minister for Small Business (which is applauded), the needs of the self employed, in many cases, are very different to even small employers.
This needs to be addressed
attributes.additional_details:
Areas that need addressing include (but are not limited to):

- The need for a 'self employed bank account' - A simple transactional account
- Affordable financial services - Realistically priced income protection and medical cover should be introduced.
- The levelling of the playing field in terms of maternity and paternity
- Increased Pension provision - employees are being encouraged to enrolled into a Workplace Pension.  What is the sole trader equivalent?   

What else can you add?

attributes.action: Force UK Cell Network operators to provided Cell Networks fit for rural business
attributes.background:
When in rural areas it is often impossible to make mobile phone calls and when possible the reliability of the signal is very poor, this includes both Voice and Data signals.
Agricultural businesses use mobile signals for different reasons, these system are often unreliable due to poor networks
attributes.additional_details:
Use mobile devises for voice or data in French rural areas then repeat this in the UK, there is a major difference in performance, the UK offering a system which is often poor in quality, unpredictable & not fit for purpose.
The difference appears to be the fact that the French system roams between providers while the UK doesn't allow UK devises to roam.
Poor quality UK Networks costs rural business and needs to be improved urgently. Rural UK business need a system fit for purpose.

attributes.action: All photoshopped/modified images of models to explicitly state their editing
attributes.background: We call for the Government to pass this simple yet awareness-raising law that ensures all edited images must state that they have been tampered with. We also hope to decrease the value that physical appearance has in our society, increasing the value of other qualities that truly make us human.
attributes.additional_details: The effect the media's portrayal of 'perfection' has on young people is that ‘self worth’ is based solely on an unattainable, generic, no-room-for-difference physical appearance. By passing this simple law stating that an image has been edited, by literally showing that models do not naturally look the way they are presented, we can raise awareness for the true beauty of ‘imperfections’, individuality and that gorgeous spectrum that is body-size. Reintroduce reality and humanity into the media.

attributes.action: Encourage companies to provide home based jobs for the disabled/chronically ill.
attributes.background: I want more large UK companies to provide home based job roles so the disabled/chronically ill have more opportunities available to them. Many disabled/chronically ill people hate not being able to work and want to contribute, but find it hard to find a well paid job to suit their ability.
attributes.additional_details: I am a sufferer of Ulcerative Colitis, a chronic illness and form of Inflammatory Bowel Disease. I recently had to step down from my managerial role due to my illness. I  looked for a legitimate UK home based job without success. I was only able to find US based work at home jobs. I want this for the UK.

attributes.action: STOP fining parents & providing evidence of ill children who miss days of school
attributes.background: My child has missed many days of school due to Asthma. He has regular flare ups and suffers with coughing fits/ weasiness & breathlessness as a result also causing lack of sleep and the need to stay at home. We are facing a court proceedings because of his low school attendance percentage.
attributes.additional_details: We have had to provide /medical evidence' and letters of consent from a doctor to say he is unfit for school. This is discriminating against a parents' verbal word, making us feel like liars when our child is poorly. This takes up valuable doctors appointments, when our children are not always needed to be seen by a doctor. Other bugs fly around schools where we should also keep our children at home but not see a doctor. STOP PROSECUTING PARENTS for educational statistical targets!

attributes.action: To apply CCTV in to the family courts.
attributes.background: To end the corruption in family courts, proceedings should be recorded. These recordings could be passed onto the police to enable them to investigate if allegations of lying under oath are made.
attributes.additional_details: By adding CCTV to prevent social workers, judges and parents from lying or turn them away from the idea of lying under oath.

attributes.action: Extend the "Help to Buy: Mortgage Guarantee" scheme until at least December 2017
attributes.background: The governments "Help to Buy: Mortgage Guarantee" scheme is due to end in December 2016. This allows buyers (not just 1st time) to put down a 5% deposit with the next 20% of the mortgage guaranteed by the government; this give lenders additional security against people defaulting on their mortgage.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the start of the scheme around 73,726 houses have been purchased with support from the scheme; of which 79% have been first time buyers. (Stats from www.gov.uk)

Extending this scheme would allow thousands more people the opportunity to purchase their first house in times when getting a large lump sum of cash for a deposit over 5% can be extremely difficult.

Additional information about how the scheme works can be seen here:
www.helptobuy.gov.uk/mortgage-guarantee/how-does-it-work/

attributes.action: Debate restrictions on the sale of button batteries.
attributes.background: Button batteries are an under recognised and unregulated risk to children. They look like sweets and are sold without restriction or appropriate packaging on the high street.  When swallowed they often get stuck in the throat cause severe burns with life threatening complications.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.rospa.com/home-safety/advice/product/button-cell-batteries/

http://www.afpp.org.uk/filegrab/1psa-button-batteries.pdf?ref=1923

http://www.independent.co.uk/voices/campaigns/give-to-gosh/great-ormond-street-hospital-surgeon-warns-of-the-dangers-of-button-batteries-a6783641.html

attributes.action: Change the education list to include martial arts in P.E
attributes.background: This years GCSE list does not included martial arts. How can this happen when we are all trying to stop obesity.
attributes.additional_details: Also how do the younger generation feel if they are pursuing a lifetime ambition to represent their country and find they cannot take there chosen martial art as a option in the GSCE P.E format.

attributes.action: Update Parliamentary procedures so that impeachment is reinstated as a sanction
attributes.background: During the referendum campaign, MPs Boris Johnson, Andrea Leadsom and others continually made the statement  that we, in the UK, ‘send the EU £350 million a week.’ This statement  is untrue. They included the UK rebate in this figure. However, the rebate never leaves these shores
attributes.additional_details: Despite being continually told that this statement was untrue, these MPs continued to repeat it. Impeachment was used as a method for holding MPs to account. However, it is claimed by some that it is 'obsolete' and cannot be used as a sanction. Without impeachment there appears to be no way of holding MPs and others to account for this type of behaviour. So let us call on Parliament to update and reinstate impeachment to deter other MPs from this type of egregious behaviour.

attributes.action: Rules on assisted living need to be based on need not age
attributes.background: My father is heavily disabled and has been turned down by an assisted living organisation because he isn't 60, there are far more abled people within this home, this needs to be based on the need of the person not the age of the person. Assessment of the care required vs age restriction is a must

attributes.action: Make learning about FGM part of the curriculum
attributes.background: FGM happens from birth to adolescent it happens all over the world . Even thought It's illegal in the uk it's still practised. Raising awareness of FGM will help people understand the issues it makes girls everywhere face and enable people to comprehend that it's a violation of human rights.

attributes.action: Make audio-visual announcements be included in the government's new 'Buses Bill'
attributes.background: If the government are reviewing the overall regulation of the industry then it would be a suitable time to ensure that bus networks are fully accessible. Audio-visual technology speaks and displays next and final stop information, assisting those visually impaired to use the bus with confidence.
attributes.additional_details:
I am petitioning as I would like to see the government's new bill include a requirement for ‘Talking Buses’. These are buses which include on board audio-visual (A/V) next stop and final destination announcements, as well as other important information regarding the service. This vital assistive technology enables people who are blind or visually impaired to get the bus independently and with confidence.

This technology is a rarity outside London, and that needs to change!

attributes.action: Enact that The House of Lords become the People's House, elected by direct P R
attributes.background: The House of Lords is an unelected body of career appointees. It serves the people worse than did the Hereditary Peers, under the Bill of Rights and the Parliament Act of 1911 The Lords must effectively balance the Commons (which increasingly does not serve the People); a PR HoL will do so.

attributes.action: Make compulsory all dogs in public spaces eg parks, footpaths etc to be on lead
attributes.background: The number of people, dogs and even farming livestock being attacked by dogs off lead is increasing. By making it compulsory for dogs to be on lead in public spaces at all times could reverse this trend. On the spot fines should be introduced.

attributes.action: Ban remote gambling nationwide, it is dangerous and destroying lives.
attributes.background: British families are being destroyed by remote (online) gambling. Individuals can easily lose property, retirement funds, business money, savings, and wages from the comfort of their homes and within hours resulting in suicide, depression, divorce and losing their children. It needs to be banned.
attributes.additional_details: Under section 24 of the Gambling Act 2005 - 'Children and other vulnerable people are protected from being harmed or exploited by gambling'. Age vertification and self-exclusion are not enough to protect the children of problem gamblers or the millions of UK citizens who would be deemed 'vulnerable'. Since most online gambling operators are based outside of the UK there is no financial gain for the British people that would remotely justify these companies being able to transact with or advertise to consumers in Britain.

attributes.action: Stop using schools as polling stations
attributes.background: Thousands of schools close during elections for use as polling stations.  This is extremely disruptive to children's education and costs parents in terms of lost earnings, annual leave or childcare.  Schools are seen as the easy option, when alternative facilities could be made available.
attributes.additional_details: Every year schools are closed to be used as polling stations during local elections, general elections and referendums, causing disruption to education and cost to parents. Given that the government has placed such high importance on school attendance (fining parents £60 for a day missed) it is hypocritical closing schools to save money during elections, particularly when the cost falls on parents. Schools cannot remain open with the general public on the premises so alternatives should be found

attributes.action: Reform the GCSE for child care level 3- so we do not need a C in GCSE
attributes.background: So other's who are capable of working with children but are not capable of gaining a GCSE'S at a C grade in English and Maths and still continue to qualify and be counted as a level 3.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement that all cats be microchipped
attributes.background: The UK Government should change the law to make it a legal requirement for all cat owners to have their pet(s) microchipped.
attributes.additional_details:
Since April 2016 it has been UK law that all pet dogs be fitted with a sterile microchip. This aids in identification when pets go missing, are stolen or get injured.

Cats enjoy roaming over vast areas around their homes.  In too many unfortunate cases cats are lost, injured or stolen and many are not fitted with microchips, making it nearly impossible to locate their owners. And with the worrying number of cat murders in the South East, it is especially important to chip your cat.

attributes.action: Stop horses and cyclists using roads with higher than 30mph speed limits
attributes.background: As a car enthusiast who uses social media a lot and also having freinds with horses and a few who cycle I see a lot of posts arguing about safety on the roads. I think the simplest place to start is to keep both horses and cyclists in lower speed limit areas reducing the risk of accidents hopefully.

attributes.action: Provide GCSE Physics and combined science students with a formula sheet in exams
attributes.background: From 2016 onward the changes to the GCSE specification means that students will have to recall a large number of equations, that were previously provided on formula sheet. We think this in unfair and is a test of recall and not a test of their scientific knowledge or understanding  .
attributes.additional_details:
As teachers we think this unfairly disadvantages students of a lower attainment level, students who first language is not English and students who have special educational needs relating to memory. 
We call on the government to require Ofqual to instruct the exam boards to change this and to provide students with a full formula sheet.

attributes.action: Commit to close the funding gap in UK science research left by leaving the EU
attributes.background: The UK is a key player in international scientific research, accounting for nearly 16 percent of the most cited articles. The EU funded up to 17 percent of HEI grants, this deficit must now be met. Intellectual property is a vital british export, investment is of crucial importance to our economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Extra detail about how the EU helped UK science and they key issues that must be addressed:

http://scientistsforeu.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/SfEU_factsheet_12-2-2016.pdf

attributes.action: To ask the UK government to call a General Election after the referendum
attributes.background:
After the referendum the nation will have made a decision in relation to the direction with which to take the country. 

This is more important in the event of a vote leave result

Its only fair and democratic that the citizens of the UK are allowed to chose a government to lead through change

attributes.action: Make chronic stomach/bowel conditions eligible for a disabled person's railcard
attributes.background: Many people who suffer from chronic stomach/bowel illnesses such as inflammatory bowel disease and irritable bowel syndrome will opt to use trains for long distance journeys, due to their accessible toilets, on demand. Due to the need for accessible toilets, we ask that sufferers receive a discount.
attributes.additional_details: Toilets are a major necessity for people who suffer from stomach/bowel conditions as they can be urgently needed at any time during a journey. This can prevent people from driving long journeys as service stations can often be few and far between. We ask that the government add chronic stomach/bowel illnesses to the list of conditions eligible for a disabled persons railcard. In some cases, people will choose a train journey instead of long car journeys to avoid embarrassment, anxiety and pain.

attributes.action: Reduce school summer holidays for special needs students
attributes.background:
Children that suffer from autism etc find summer holidays a distressing upheaval to their usual routine. This can cause them to violently lash out. 
These children struggle after six weeks and find it very hard to settle back into a routine at school which is distressing for all those around.
attributes.additional_details: I am a mother of an autistic child.  I see the effect even just a week half term has on my son, so how does the government expect him to cope with 6 whole weeks?!  I am not the one parent that feels the holidays are far too long for these children. The government have been saying for years they will cut the archaic 6 week holidays yet they haven't made any adjustment.

attributes.action: Investigate why there so many accidents on the M5 roadworks around Droitwich.
attributes.background: Since the roadworks were started between J6 and J4A and the lane restrictions were implemented, there have been almost daily incidents causing huge delays on this stretch of the M5. It's not as bad on similar motorway roadworks, so what's different about this stretch and what can be done about it?

attributes.action: Stop the delay in welcoming lone refugee children.
attributes.background: Save the Children originally asked for 3000 unaccompanied refugee children to be allowed into the UK. After an amendment, which changed this to an “unspecified” number of children, was added to the bill, it became part of the Immigration Act in May 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
It is stated that around one unaccompanied refugee child is accepted into the UK every 18 days. These children have a perilous journey and only some are lucky enough to make it to a camp. 

Many of these children are being used as sex slaves and even have their organs sold. 50% that were tested in Italy had sexually transmitted diseases. 

The purpose of this petition, is to demand the government act immediately to bring these children to the UK in far greater numbers than just TWENTY per YEAR!

attributes.action: Stop plans for Transition Government in Zimbabwe that includes ZANU PF ministers
attributes.background: ZANU PF and life President Robert Mugabe via a system of patronage over the last 36 years has systematically destroyed the economy of Zimbabwe & impoverished its people. At the same time elite Ministers and cronies have become wealthy beyond measure, by effectively looting Zimbabwe's resources.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government in it's secretive Foreign Office has unilaterally decided that a TRANSITIONAL GOVERNMENT will be put in place to avoid "REGIONAL CHAOS" [sic], WHICH WILL INCLUDE the "elite" referred to in the previously. 
ZANU PF Ex-Ministers/Civil Servants/Sponsors cannot in any form be linked to Government or control of Finances. 
They will simply use this money to rig the 2018 elections as they have clearly done in 2008 and 2013 by using DEADLY VIOLENCE and systematic VOTER FRAUD

attributes.action: Allow 15 - 17 Year Olds to be able to Vote in a 2nd EU Referendum
attributes.background: Since the Scottish Referendum in 2014 allowed voters as young as 16 to decide the future of their country, we believe that there should be a second referendum about Britain's EU membership, that allows voters as young as 15 to vote for our future.
attributes.additional_details: Many teenagers and young people were very well informed and very vocal about the EU referendum online, but in the end, were not given a chance to decide our own fate.

attributes.action: Replace the Human Rights Act with a UK Bill of Rights
attributes.background: We need to scrap the European Human Rights directives implementation in the UK and replace it with a UK Bill of Rights.
attributes.additional_details:
The Human Rights which the British government helped create has become a joke and we have lost control of the UK's criminal system, unable to deport people who actively want to harm British citizens back to their home countries.

We need a bill of rights that protects the British people.

attributes.action: Full HMRC investigation into the  Panama Papers
attributes.background:
It has recently come to light through an industrial scale leak, namely the Panama Papers, that some UK individuals and businesses may have profited through tax avoidance overseas via shell companies. 
 
It is only right a full investigation by HMRC is conducted.

attributes.action: Stop the super-rich avoiding tax: set a £40 million cap on money put into trusts
attributes.background: The super-rich can put limitless assets into trusts so that their beneficiaries pay only a fraction of the taxes they would otherwise owe.  We've seen this recently with the 7th Duke of Westminster, who will avoid paying £3.6 billion inheritance tax.  A £40 million cap would stop this.
attributes.additional_details: It's not illegal for the super-rich to put these assets into trusts but it deprives the Treasury of significant income.   The 7th Duke's unpaid contribution could have built 40 hospitals (at £90 million per hospital, including equipment and infrastructure) and would have represented almost 80% of the total inheritance tax paid to HMRC in 2015-16.  The £40 million cap is based on the BBC's figure (January 2015) that to join the super-rich you need to be worth $50-$100 million.

attributes.action: Take Portugal's stances and decriminalize all drug possession.
attributes.background: The Portuguese government have decriminalised all illegal drugs. Drug addicts should not be treated like criminals and should be helped, not punished. Portugal has one of the lowest drug overdose rates in Europe whereas the UK has the highest.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drug_policy_of_Portugal

attributes.action: Consider a vote of no confidence in Stephen Crabb
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, strongly disapprove of the way that Stephen Crabb has been operating in his role as the Work and Pensions Secretary. Parliament should debate a motion of no confidence in him immediately.

attributes.action: Introduce controls to curb the sky rocketing cost of renting within London.
attributes.background: The cost of renting is rising exponentially each year, leading to people living in sub-standard accommodation. Not everyone in London wishes to buy and while the government focuses on increasing the supply of affordable housing, it is hard to see how this will help curb extortionate rental prices.
attributes.additional_details:
It is difficult to find a 2 bed flat in zones 1-3 for less than £1450pm. This leads to young adults, families & students who aren't looking to buy or are trying to save a deposit living in overcrowded, shared accommodation. 
For most, there is little option but to turn to rental websites like 'Spareroom' and move into the ex-living room of a 3 bed shared house for £600 pm. If you are lucky, there will be 1 bathroom per 4 people. Sadly, most spend more than half their income on ever rising rent.

attributes.action: After The EU, Let The Public Decide Where £350 Million A Week Should Be Spent .
attributes.background:
After the EU Referendum held on June 23rd 2016, the public made a democratic decision not to spend £350 million a week on the EU. 

As the public made the democratic decision not to spend it on the EU, the public should now democratically decide what £350 million per week should then be spent on.
attributes.additional_details:
As Agriculture received the largest amount back from the money spent on EU membership, the government must pledge that the higher percentage of the money saved from not being in the EU will be spent on agriculture. 

Every 4 years the public should then have a democratic say on where the remaining percentage should be spent, through official voting on a ballot, with boxes asking if the money should be spent; either: completely on the NHS, on public services, or education. This must be honoured.

attributes.action: We want the government to set clear National guidance on the use of restraint.
attributes.background:
We want the government to set clear National guidance on the use of restraint on children and young people in schools and care facilities.
All special schools, residential facilities and mainstream schools (that use restraint) must also have sound recording CCTV were restraint is used.
attributes.additional_details: Children/young people with disabilities are being restrained and injured, my son has been both physically and mentally damaged through restraint and the Government must set clear guidance and standards to safeguard our children/young people.

attributes.action: Amend Environment Protection Act to allow prompt rubbish removal on private land
attributes.background: Fly-tipping in many areas is getting out of hand. Often, rubbish is dumped in privately-owned alleys, garage areas, etc. Soon, the dumping is extended to adjacent pavements. The legal process for local authoritues to gain access, clear the land and recoup expenses is lengthy and costly.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst the local authority embarks on the legal process, the problem escalates and more work is then required to keep on top of the rubbish now accruing in the public space.  The heaps of rubbish present health, fire and other safety risks in the meantime.

Local authorities should be allowed to issue a warning letter with a short notice period to remove the rubbish. Guidance and assistance should be provided to those landowners affected by persistent fly-tipping through no fault of there own.

attributes.action: Petition, Allow MARINE LE PEN into the U.K. to give her Views On British Brexit.
attributes.background: Cameron allowed Obama into the U.K. To meet the Queen & to give his views on British Remaining in The E.U.
attributes.additional_details: Why allow Barack Hussein Obama, but not allow Donald Trump & Marine Le Pen, when Marine Le Pen has a European Passport?

attributes.action: Move Trident from Scotland to Plymouth Devon
attributes.background: Scotland do not want Trident and the SNP have been fighting this vehemently . Meanwhile in Plymouth we have the capacity and would welcome the jobs with open arms
